thread.section_title: Sports and Weather Right Now - Idaho Sports Headlines
thread.title: Southern Utah handles Weber State 44-0

title: Southern Utah handles Weber State 44-0
text:
Southern Utah handles Weber State 44-0   Southern Utah handles Weber State 44-0 Posted: Updated: 
ODGEN, Utah (AP) - LeShaun Sims and Taylor Nelson both returned interceptions for touchdowns and Southern Utah beat Weber State 41-0 on Friday night. 
Sims picked off Justin Shaw midway through the second quarter and took it 26 yards to put the Thunderbirds up 14-0. Nelson's fourth-quarter pick of Shaw went for 19 yards. 
Southern Utah (3-2, 2-0 Big Sky) went up 7-0 on Naia Ursua's 68-yard punt return for a touchdown and led 17-0 at the half when Keita Calhoun added a 33-yard field goal as time expired. 
Mike Sharp and Jarom Healey had short touchdown runs in the third quarter. Ammon Olsen was 24 of 40 for 242 yards and completed passes to 12 different receivers. 
Weber State (2-3, 1-1) turned it over six times. Shaw was 0 for 4 with three picks and Jadrian Clark went 12 of 30 for 134 yards with two interceptions. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. More >> SEATTLE, Wash. - Seattle   Tuesday.“Jerry   More >> Anderson-Dolan Impresses in Season Opener, Leads Chiefs to 6-4 Win Over Americans Jaret Anderson-Dolan scored a hat-trick in the Chiefs season opener, on the way to a 6-4 win. Rookie forward Jaret Anderson-Dolan picked an opportune time to score the first three goals of his young WHL career, netting a hat trick to lead the Spokane Chiefs to a come-from-behind 6-4 win over the rival Tri-City Americans on Saturday Night at Spokane Arena. Forward Hudson Elynuik earned the distinction of scoring the Chiefs' first goal of the 2015-16 regular season, punching in a rebound opportunity just 1:14 into regulation.
